original: Karlgren, Nils, auktoriserad revisor, Göteborg, f. 11/8/99 i Söderhamn av kommin. Anton K. o. Esther af Schmidt. G. 25 m. Elisabeth Kekoni-us. Barn: Bo f. 26, stud. v. CTH, Per-Gunnar 29, Sten 33. — Stud:ex. i Sthlm 18, ekon. ex. v. HHS 21, stud. i Engl. o. Frankr. (som Liljevalchs stip.) 22-23. Anst. i bank 21-24, han-delskamm. 25-27, auktor. rev. 25, egen rev:byrå i Gbg sed. 29. Medl. av Bachelors Club. Skr.: Bokföring — handb. f. bokför, o. köpmän (tredje uppl. 38). Hobbies: bridge, jakt, segling.
translated: Karlgren, Nils, authorized auditor, Gothenburg, b. August 11, 1899 in Söderhamn to minister Anton K. and Esther af Schmidt. Married on May 25 with Elisabeth Kekoni (maiden name). Children: Bo, b. 1926, studying at CTH (likely a university), Per-Gunnar, b. 1929, Sten, b. 1933. Passed matriculation exam in Stockholm in 1918, economics exam at HHS (likely the Stockholm School of Economics) in 1921, studied in England and France (as a recipient of Liljevalchs scholarship) from 1922-1923. Employed in a bank from 1921-1924, chamber of commerce from 1925-1927, authorized auditor from 1925, own auditing firm in Gothenburg since 1929. Member of the Bachelors Club. Wrote: Bookkeeping - handbook for bookkeepers and merchants (3rd edition, 1938). Hobbies: bridge, hunting, sailing.

publication.name: Bookkeeping - handbook for bookkeepers and merchants
